item.title: [KPIGREEN] KPI Green Energy Allots 1 Crore Equity Warrants to Promoter Entity Quyosh Energia
item.description:
KPI Green Energy Limited has allotted 1,01,00,000 fully convertible equity warrants to Quyosh Energia Private Limited, an entity belonging to the Promoter group. The warrants have an exercise price of 470.30 with a premium of 7465.30 per warrant. Each warrant is convertible into one fully paid-up Equity Share of Rs. 5/- each on payment of the balance 75% of the total consideration. The securities allotted on a preferential basis shall be subject to lock-in restriction as prescribed under the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Issue of Capital and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2018.

item.title: [GLAND] Gland Pharma Appoints Dr. Jitendra Gangwal as Vice President (R&D) from Feb 18, 2026
item.description:
Gland Pharma Ltd. has appointed Dr. Jitendra Gangwal as Vice President (Research and Development) with effect from February 18, 2026. Dr. Gangwal is a seasoned pharmaceutical R&D leader with 24 years of experience across premier research institutions and leading Indian pharmaceutical organizations. He has developed 55 products, filed 10 patents, and led multiple 505(b)(2) and ANDA filings. His expertise includes complex parenterals, nano-crystals, liposomes, microspheres, depot systems, peptides, metal complexes, and advanced polymer-based delivery systems. Dr. Gangwal holds a PhD from National Chemical Laboratory, Pune.

  • Dr. Jitendra Gangwal appointed as Vice President (R&D) of Gland Pharma Ltd.
  • Dr. Gangwal has 24 years of experience in pharmaceutical R&D.
  • He has developed 55 products and filed 10 patents.
  • His expertise includes complex parenterals, nano-crystals, and liposomes.

item.title: [GLOBECIVIL] Globe Civil Projects India Limited Announces Q3 & 9M FY26 Financial Results: Steady Execution Reflects Operational Discipline and Order-Led Growth
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Globe Civil Projects India Limited, an EPC-focused infrastructure company, has announced its unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025. The Company demonstrated stable operational execution during the period, supported by progress across ongoing projects and disciplined cost management within its Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) operations. The key financial highlights for the nine months ended December 31, 2025, include a total income of 2481.37 million, a net profit of 175.67 million, and a net profit margin of ~7.07%. For the third quarter of the financial year 2026, the Company reported a total income of 937.57 million, a net profit of 65.28 million, and a net profit margin of ~6.96%. The consolidated financial highlights for the nine months ended December 31, 2025, include a total income of 2645.70 million, a net profit of 3175.41 million, and a net profit margin of 6.63%.

  • Steady execution across EPC projects reflects operational discipline and order-led growth.
  • Total income for 9M FY26 stands at 2481.37 million with a net profit of 175.67 million.
  • Total income for Q3 FY26 is 937.57 million with a net profit of 65.28 million.
  • Consolidated total income for 9M FY26 is 2645.70 million with a net profit of 3175.41 million.
  • Company remains committed to strengthening execution capabilities, improving working capital efficiency, and pursuing opportunities aligned with its risk framework.

item.title: [SCI] Shipping Corporation of India's Director (Finance) Position Temporarily Filled by Director (Personnel & Administration)
item.description:
The Shipping Corporation of India Ltd. has announced that the Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways has informed them about the approval from the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) for the entrustment of additional charge of the post of Director (Finance) to Shri Som Raj, Director (Personnel & Administration), SCI. This appointment is for a period of three months starting from 1st January 2026, or until the assumption of charge of the post by the regular incumbent, or until further orders, whichever is the earliest.

  • The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) has approved the entrustment of additional charge of the post of Director (Finance) to Shri Som Raj, Director (Personnel & Administration), SCI.
  • The appointment is for a period of three months starting from 1st January 2026.
  • The appointment is subject to the assumption of charge of the post by the regular incumbent or until further orders.
